intro: Microphacos, commonly known as the small-flowered rockrose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cactaceae. It is native to South America, particularly in regions of Chile and Argentina. The plants are typically small shrubs with spiny stems and showy, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. Microphacos species are adapted to arid environments and have developed mechanisms to conserve water. Their flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to their ecological significance in desert ecosystems.
